response.original_title: Ian Hunter Band Live At Rockpalast
response.overview: Ian Hunter, leader and singer of Mott The Hoople with Mick Ronson, longtime companion and guitarist of David Bowie!  These two names are still much valued by those, who love and celebrate good Rock'n'Roll: Ian Hunter, leader und singer of Mott The Hoople & Mick Ronson, longtime companion and guitarist of David Bowie's Spiders From Mars. The 6th Rockpalast night at 19th to 20th of April 1980 was a really outstanding event in the long history of the high acclaimed Rockpalast-festival-series.  The charismatic performance of Ian Hunter and his longtime companion Mick Ronson climaxed in breathtaking versions of "Once Bitten Twice Shy", The Mott The Hoople classic "All The Young Dudes", written by David Bowie for Ian Hunter or Slaughter On 10th Avenue.
response.tagline: Ian Hunter - Live At Rockpalast Featuring Mick Ronson
response.title: Ian Hunter Band Live At Rockpalast
